de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.datastructures.histogram

Class IntArrayStaticHistogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.datastructures.histogram.AbstractStaticHistogram
      • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.datastructures.histogram.AbstractObjStaticHistogram<int[]>
        • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.datastructures.histogram.IntArrayStaticHistogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Histogram, ObjHistogram<int[]>

    public final class IntArrayStaticHistogram
extends AbstractObjStaticHistogram<int[]>
    Histogram containing an array of ints (i.e. int[]). This is actually one of the simpler specializations, as arrays are objects not primitive in Java.
    Since:
    0.5.5
    Author:
    Erich Schubert

        public void increment(double coord,

        Increment histogram by a double[].
        Parameters:

      • putData

        @Deprecated
public void putData(double coord,
                      int[] data)
        Deprecated. use the explicit increment(double, int[]) instead.
        Aggregate new data into the histogram. Note that the actual definition of "aggregate" depends on the application. While a static histogram will likely perform this immediately, a flexible histogram will cache a number of observations. Data is combined by incrementing.
        Parameters:
        coord - Coordinate
        data - Data
